titles.title: The Emperor kissing the Pope's Toe from 'Passional Christi und Antichristi'

classification.condition: Used in: Passional Christi und Antichristi, Johann Rhau-Grunenberg, Wittenberg 1521

pageContext.description:
Cranach completed the 'Passional Christi und Antichristi' with 26 woodcut illustrations in March 1521 just before the Reichstag in Worms convened. The book was published as authorless, but contains quotations from the Bible and the canon law chosen by Philipp Melanchthon and Johann Schwertfeger. Cranach polemically employed opposites by juxtaposing scenes from Christ's Passion with events from the Pope's life to show how far removed it was from Christ's message. Here the text is located beneath the image. 
[This image shows 'The Emperor kissing the Pope's toe' and is juxtaposed with an image of 'Christ washing the Apostles' Feet'.]
[Exhib. Cat. Düsseldorf 2017, 196, No. 100]
